define-assembly.name: METASCHEMA
define-assembly.description: A declaration of the Metaschema module.

define-flag.name: abstract
define-flag.description: Determines if the Metaschema module is abstract ('yes') or not ('no').

define-field.name: schema-name
define-field.description: The name of the information model represented by this Metaschema definition.

define-field.name: schema-version
define-field.description: A version string used to distinguish between multiple revisions of the same Metaschema module.

define-field.name: short-name
define-field.description: A short (code) name to be used for the Metaschema module. This name may be used as a constituent of names assigned to derived artifacts, such as schemas and conversion utilities.

define-field.name: namespace
define-field.description: The namespace for the collection of Metaschema module this Metaschema module belongs to. This value is also used as the XML namespace governing the names of elements in XML documents. By using this namespace, documents and document fragments used in mixed-format environments may be distinguished from neighbor XML formats using another namespaces. This value is not reflected in Metaschema JSON.

define-field.name: json-base-uri
define-field.description: The JSON Base URI is the nominal base URI assigned to a JSON Schema instance expressing the model defined by this Metaschema module.

define-assembly.name: import
define-assembly.description: Imports a set of Metaschema modules contained in another resource. Imports support the reuse of common information structures.

define-flag.name: href
define-flag.description: A relative or absolute URI for retrieving an out-of-line Metaschema definition.

define-assembly.name: define-assembly
define-assembly.description: In XML, an element with structured element content. In JSON, an object with properties. Defined globally, an assembly can be assigned to appear in the model of any assembly (another assembly type, or itself), by assembly reference.

define-field.name: root-name
define-field.description: Provides a root name, for when the definition is used as the root of a node hierarchy.

define-assembly.name: json-value-key-flag
define-assembly.formal-name: Flag Used as the Field Value's JSON Property Name

allowed-values.enum: Always use an array.
Produce a singleton for a single member or an array for multiple members.
For any group of one or more members, produce an object with properties for each member, using a designated flag for their property name values, which must be distinct.
Use a wrapper element.
Do not use a wrapper element.
This definition is only available in the context of the current Metaschema module.
This definition will be made available to any Metaschema module that includes this one either directly or indirectly through a chain of imported Metaschemas.
Block contents of a markup-multiline field will be represented with a containing (wrapper) element in the XML.
Block contents of a markup-multiline will be represented in the XML with no wrapper, making the field implicit. Among sibling fields in a given model, only one of them may be designated as UNWRAPPED.
Alias for WRAPPED.

define-field.name: formal-name
define-field.description: A formal name for the data construct, to be presented in documentation.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: A short description of the data construct's purpose, describing the constructs semantics.

define-field.name: use-name
define-field.description: Allows the name of the definition to be overridden.

define-flag.name: alt-name-index
define-flag.description: Used for binary formats instead of the textual name.

define-assembly.name: json-key
define-assembly.description: Used in JSON (and similar formats) to identify a flag that will be used as the property name in an object hold a collection of sibling objects. Requires that siblings must never share json-key values.

define-flag.name: flag-ref
define-flag.description: References the flag that will serve as the JSON key.

define-field.name: remarks
define-field.description: Any explanatory or helpful information to be provided about the remarks parent.

define-flag.name: class
define-flag.description: Mark as 'XML' for XML-only or 'JSON' for JSON-only remarks.

allowed-values.enum: The remark applies to only XML representations.
The remark applies to only JSON and YAML representations.
The remark applies to all representations.
A violation of the constraint represents a serious fault in the content that will prevent typical use of the content.
A violation of the constraint represents a fault in the content. This may include issues around compatibility, integrity, consistency, etc.
A violation of the constraint represents a potential issue with the content.
A violation of the constraint represents a point of interest.

define-flag.name: constraint-extensible
define-flag.description: Determines if the given enumerated values may be extended by other allowed value constraints.

allowed-values.enum: Can be extended by constraints within the same module.
Can be extended by external constraints.
Cannot be extended.
